basics.name: Dr. Sergey Negrashov
basics.label: Applied Physicist/Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Software Engineer with a lot of experience in precision measurement and high speed communication. I worked on a number of high energy physics experiments as well as defence projects. My doctorate degree was in the field of sensor networks and smart grids.

location.address: 1680 E West Rd Honolulu, HI 96822  Room 329

work.summary: Hardware/Software R&D for custom IR detectors.
highlights: Design and Development for ultra-fast midwave IR sensor.
FPGA development to enable readout over 100G ethernet link.
Software for capturing and processing ~1M packets per second.
Lead software development across multiple subcontractors and staff.

work.company: UH Manoa Information and Computer Science
work.summary: Teaching the lab section of ICS111 and ICS 331
Hardware R&D for a particle physics experement.
highlights: Design and develop electronics for a ultaportable directional neutrino detector.
Lead a team during the detector calibration and deployment at the NIST Center for Neutron Research Reactor.
Developed FPGA firmware and Linux software for detector operation, and data analysis

work.company: University of Hawaii graduate student organisation
work.summary: Working with UH administration to improve the working conditions for UH graduate students.

volunteer.summary: Teaching 6th-8th graders how to program in Javascript and Logo.
Graduate student funding and grant review.

Alohamask was a volunteer organisation aimed at alleviating the shortage of PPE in the state of Hawaii during the COVID-19 crisis. Using the industrial laser cutter at the University of Hawaii, I produced 10k precut masks, that were then sewen by our volunteers and distributed to hospitals and first responders.
